quest.name: Freedom from Privilege
journal: Lue-Reeq is, as usual, quite pleased to see you again.

Another of Lue-Reeq's hirelings has provided him with new information concerning a sighting of Andreia on Kholusia. It would seem that the Virtue has transformed yet another deadly mark into a sin eater─this time a great bear. And so it falls to Reeq and Forename to slay yet another newborn fiend.

As before, the plan is simple: seek out and slay the eater and hope that in so doing you happen to encounter its creator. As before, Lue-Reeq declares that the most effective course of action would be to search separately.
It would not be an engaging hunt if you found your quarry that quickly, and so it is premature to declare this particular one a failure. Probably...

You continue your search for a time, but it gradually becomes apparent that it is a fool's endeavor. The bear is clearly nowhere to be seen, and it is past time you and Lue-Reeq reconsidered your plan.

You find Lue-Reeq in the company of several other hunters who apparently managed to track down and kill the bear before you could. Their leader, Lanbyrd, is a former associate of Lue-Reeq's it would seem, until the pair had a falling out, leading Lanbyrd to strike out on his own. Being familiar with his former partner's methods, he surmised that by bribing his hirelings to share their findings with him first, he could beat the Mystel hunter to the punch, and sure enough, he managed to do just that. And so you prepare to quit Kholusia, but not before paying a brief visit to Eulmore at Lue-Reeq's behest.

As a courtesy─or perhaps simply to let them know that he's getting on well enough─Lue-Reeq attempts to introduce you to his lord father, a wealthy Eulmoran who cares for naught but his indulgences like so many others. Indeed, his attempt fails spectacularly, as the aristocrat hardly spares a glance for his son or for you, and states that he should speak with his manservant if he is in dire need of more coin. In a fit of emotion, Lue-Reeq storms off, and so you accompany him back to the Crystarium.

Lue-Reeq confesses to you what most others have already surmised: that he was born into privilege as a child of a Eulmoran free citizen. Raised without want or worry, he has since grown tired of the lackadaisical city life, and so he came to the Crystarium that he might become a bounty hunter─a quest that henceforth may be that much more difficult given that he refused to take more of his father's coin. However, you reassure him that this need not be cause to end your partnership. At least, not immediately.

※The next role quest will be available from Lue-Reeq upon reaching level 76 in any physical DPS class.
objectives: Search for the bearlike sin eater.
Speak with Lue-Reeq in the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: There shehe is! Forename, come to rejoin herhis bosom companion in the great hunt!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: It is well that you have, for I have obtained new information concerning a sighting of Andreia on Kholusia. The fiend has transformed yet another deadly mark─a great bear in this instance─into an even deadlier eater.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: And so it falls to Reeq and Forename to slay the newborn eater and continue their pursuit of Norvrandt's most notorious Virtue. To Kholusia and to glory!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Let us brook no further delay and commence our search. Separately, as before in Amh Araeng. If you catch the eater first, I grant you leave to kill it without me. I trust you will not be disappointed if the reverse were to occur? Surely not, surely not!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: I myself will be most put out if I happen to lose to you a second time, and so, on that note: may the best hunter win!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You survey your surroundings, but find no trace of the bear you seek...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Despite looking far and wide, you fail to find any trace of the bear you seek. Perhaps Lue-Reeq was indeed the better hunter this day...

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: Wicked white, don't tell me you're the little lordling's newest “bosom companion”?

dialogue.name: DRAHNCONJURER
dialogue.text: After the bear, were you? Sorry, sinner, but you've come too late. We claimed the bounty not but a few bells ago.

dialogue.name: GALDJENTGLADIATOR
dialogue.text: To the victor go the spoils and to the loser, bugger all.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Hate to say it, Forename, but it seems we're late to the party. Lanbyrd and his mates slew the bear before we could.

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)So it's true, then─you've cast your lot in with the boy. You poor, daft sod...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: But I don't understand! The eater was a newborn. How could you possibly have learned of it and gotten here before we did?

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)Well, see, that's the problem with relying on hired help. They're loyal to your coin, not you─and you're not the only one willing to open his purse.

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)But more importantly, Reeq─what's this I hear about you hunting Andreia? With help I mean, rather than all by your lonesome.

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)I've a distinct memory of you storming off in a huff saying you didn't need me or anyone else to finish the job. Tell me I'm wrong.

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)Do as you like. Help or no, you've no chance of beating me to the prize, 'cause unlike you, I'm not all talk─and neither are me mates.

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)Speaking of mates...how much did it cost you to buy herhis “friendship”? Do tell.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Piss off, Lanbyrd! Why are you still here? You got your mark, didn't you!?

dialogue.name: LANBYRD
dialogue.text: (-Lanbyrd-)You should choose your “friends” more carefully, sinner. When it all goes wrong, don't say I didn't warn you...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: You have questions, I am sure. As you may have surmised, Lanbyrd was once a comrade of mine. I took him into my service that we might hone our skills battling sin eaters in preparation for facing Andreia.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: However, I soon came to see that he was not all that capable of a hunter, and so I dissolved our working relationship. Unfortunately, he did not take it in stride, and instead resolved to recruit new companions that he might beat me at my own game...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: It would seem that his fortunes have improved greatly of late. So much so that I fear we can no longer afford to dedicate time to tracking lesser eaters and must devote our undivided attention to the pursuit of Andreia...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: As such, we should be getting back to the Crystarium...but before we depart, I have one other matter to attend to in Eulmore. If I might trouble you to accompany me? Ah, but of course you will. Let us be off!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQFATHER
dialogue.text: ...Speak to my manservant and leave me to my entertainment.

dialogue.name: IMPASSIVESERVANT
dialogue.text: Oh! Is that Master Reeq? Then you are his, dare I say...friend?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Forename, allow me to introduce you to my father and mother...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Father, this is my traveling companion...and dear friend, Forename.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: ...SheHe and I have resolved to hunt a particularly deadly sin eater.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Indeed, I cannot overstate how terribly dangerous this eater is─that to pursue it is to court death itself. However, when we at last triumph over the fiend, all of Norvrandt shall sing our praises!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: ...Won't that be wonderful, Father...?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQFATHER
dialogue.text: ...So long as you do not sully our good name, you are free to hunt whatever quarry you desire. I can do without all the petty details.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQFATHER
dialogue.text: Now then, how much do you require this time? Out with it. Oh, never mind. Just give the boy my coinpurse, would you? I am sure it will suffice for his trivial pursuits─

dialogue.name: LUEREEQFATHER
dialogue.text: That is why you are here, is it not? Another handout? Don't play coy. You've never been any good at it.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: You know, I honestly don't know why I came here! Keep your coin, Father! We're leaving, Forename! Right now!

dialogue.name: IMPASSIVESERVANT
dialogue.text: Oh dear... Master Reeq seemed awfully upset...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename, but I would forgo the wine on this occasion. Father's lackluster reception has put me in rather dour spirits.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: As you may have gathered from our exchange, I am a free citizen of Eulmore. Owing to my parents' considerable wealth, I have enjoyed a relatively privileged upbringing. Privileged...and unbearably boring, which is why I quit the city and resolved to become a bounty hunter.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: I am no fool, though. I am well aware of my fortunate circumstances, which is why I elected to conceal them from the people of the Crystarium. People are wont to jump to uncharitable conclusions.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: I feel as though you and I have established a rapport, though, and so I thought it best to bring you into my confidence. I pray you refrain from telling others.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Now then─since Lanbyrd has decided to turn this into a race, we have no choice but to oblige him and slay Andreia before he does. This calls for a veritable army of hired hands.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Alas, in a fit of frustration, I refused Father's coin. Without additional resources, we have no choice but to conduct the search by ourselves...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Moreover, I am rather embarrassed to admit that I can pay you only a token sum at this time... B-But I trust that will not deter you from joining me anon!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I was never in this for the gil.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I don't know, I'll have to think on it...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Really...? I mean, uh, of course you weren't! Perish the thought! Hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Please, do not toy with me so! If nothing else, think of the fame and fabulous reward we'll receive when we finally slay Andreia? Surely that is incentive enough for you to stay the proverbial course!?
